modulesynopsis.name: mod_disk_cache
modulesynopsis.description: Content cache storage manager keyed to URIs

summary.p: mod_disk_cache implements a disk based storage manager. It is primarily of use in conjunction with mod_cache.
Content is stored in and retrieved from the cache using URI based keys. Content with access protection is not cached.
htcacheclean can be used to maintain the cache size at a maximum level.

note.title: Note:
note.p: mod_disk_cache requires the services of mod_cache.

note.title: Note:
note.p: mod_disk_cache uses the sendfile feature to serve files from the cache when supported by the platform, and when enabled with EnableSendfile. However, per-directory and .htaccess configuration of EnableSendfile are ignored by mod_disk_cache as the corresponding settings are not available to the module when a request is being served from the cache.

directivesynopsis.name: CacheRoot
directivesynopsis.description: The directory root under which cache files are stored

usage.p: The CacheRoot directive defines the name of the directory on the disk to contain cache files. If the mod_disk_cache module has been loaded or compiled in to the Apache server, this directive must be defined. Failing to provide a value for CacheRoot will result in a configuration file processing error. The CacheDirLevels and CacheDirLength directives define the structure of the directories under the specified root directory.

directivesynopsis.name: CacheDirLevels
directivesynopsis.description: The number of levels of subdirectories in the cache.

usage.p: The CacheDirLevels directive sets the number of subdirectory levels in the cache. Cached data will be saved this many directory levels below the CacheRoot directory.

note.p: The result of CacheDirLevels* CacheDirLength must not be higher than 20.

directivesynopsis.name: CacheDirLength
directivesynopsis.description: The number of characters in subdirectory names

usage.p: The CacheDirLength directive sets the number of characters for each subdirectory name in the cache hierarchy.

note.p: The result of CacheDirLevels* CacheDirLength must not be higher than 20.

directivesynopsis.name: CacheMinFileSize
directivesynopsis.description: The minimum size (in bytes) of a document to be placed in the cache

usage.p: The CacheMinFileSize directive sets the minimum size, in bytes, for a document to be considered for storage in the cache.

directivesynopsis.name: CacheMaxFileSize
directivesynopsis.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of a document to be placed in the cache

usage.p: The CacheMaxFileSize directive sets the maximum size, in bytes, for a document to be considered for storage in the cache.
